medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had been well until about three years before admission, when she experienced an episode of numbness in the lower left area of the face and weakness of the right arm and leg. This numbness lasted 30 to 60 minutes and did not recur. Over the two years before admission, the patient had two bouts of syncope, with the second occurring about two weeks prior to admission while standing, accompanied by palpitations and sweating. Recovery occurred after five minutes, followed by two additional attacks on the same day. A transesophageal echocardiogram the day before admission revealed two intracardiac masses.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of Cushing's syndrome diagnosed at age 3; previously treated with metyrapone, mitotane, and prednisone, leading to clinical and biochemical remission.
medical_history.social_history: The patient did not smoke or drink alcohol, took no medications, and experienced weight decline due to vigorous physical activity at work.
